content.title: So what exactly is Bitcoin?
content.text:
Bitcoin is digital money.

It can be transferred swiftly and securely between any two people in the world ‚Äî without the need for a bank or any other financial company in the middle.
feedback: Nope. You know that is not the right answer

content.title: What is a sat?
content.text:
One sat is a small portion of a bitcoin. The same way a dollar can be divided into 100 cents, a bitcoin can be divided into 100,000,000 sats! In fact, a sat is the smallest unit of bitcoin. 

Why is that important?

 Divisibility is an important part of money. 

Making bitcoin easily divisible allows many billions of people to own and use bitcoin. You do not need to own one full bitcoin. You can simply have a fraction of a bitcoin.
feedback: You just earned 1 sat, the smallest unit of Bitcoin. Congrats!
